pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
Two things:

1. Please give me write access to your repository so I can push an update to your submission code resolving most of the issues I had.
2. Is there any particular reason your point LIDAR sensors use 2 beams as opposed to 1?  Since this is a modification to the XN series we’ll have to make sure it’s normalized across all platforms so I’m open to hearing a compelling case for the 2 beams as opposed to 1 at this point before this and/or the x1 config 6 PR is accepted.  Also what sensor is this based off of to have 20m range @ 20 Hz?  I based the other off of the LIDAR Lite v3 at 40m range @ 50 Hz.

‌
content.html:
Two things:

  1. Please give me write access to your repository so I can push an update to your submission code resolving most of the issues I had.
  2. Is there any particular reason your point LIDAR sensors use 2 beams as opposed to 1? Since this is a modification to the XN series we’ll have to make sure it’s normalized across all platforms so I’m open to hearing a compelling case for the 2 beams as opposed to 1 at this point before this and/or the x1 config 6 PR is accepted. Also what sensor is this based off of to have 20m range @ 20 Hz? I based the other off of the LIDAR Lite v3 at 40m range @ 50 Hz.

‌

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
I can’t seem to add you with just your name.  I need your username and/or email address to give you permission.  Let me know what to do there.

For the point lasers, we preferably wanted to model the Terabee One rangefinders which have a range of 14 meters and I don’t know the update rate offhand.  I think 10 Hz, which would work just fine for us in the simulator as well.  We can make those changes, no problem.  

The only reason we chose to have 2 laser beams instead of 1 was because we took the 2D-lidar model from subt simulator and just reduced it down to 1 point, but this didn’t display well in rviz, so we changed it to 2, and that seemed to make rviz happy.  We only need one point.  I’m not sure where your lidarlite sensor model lives, but that would be fine as well.
content.html:
I can’t seem to add you with just your name. I need your username and/or email address to give you permission. Let me know what to do there.

For the point lasers, we preferably wanted to model the Terabee One rangefinders which have a range of 14 meters and I don’t know the update rate offhand. I think 10 Hz, which would work just fine for us in the simulator as well. We can make those changes, no problem.

The only reason we chose to have 2 laser beams instead of 1 was because we took the 2D-lidar model from subt simulator and just reduced it down to 1 point, but this didn’t display well in rviz, so we changed it to 2, and that seemed to make rviz happy. We only need one point. I’m not sure where your lidarlite sensor model lives, but that would be fine as well.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
Try using my Bitbucket username: “acschang”

Yeah, I think using some Tera\* sensor is fine.  I figured they had a bit bigger field of view than just 2 points.  I’d like to see that expanded to be accurate if possible.  It makes perfect sense to use a sensor with a FoV for the up/down scan.

Oh, the things we do for RViz.  I think the proper way to do this is just to go with a non-planar view down with some very limited FoV.  Essentially following the rough specs provided by whichever Tera\* sensor you decide on.  If you need some help on getting it to work, ping me back.
content.html:
Try using my Bitbucket username: “acschang”

Yeah, I think using some Tera* sensor is fine. I figured they had a bit bigger field of view than just 2 points. I’d like to see that expanded to be accurate if possible. It makes perfect sense to use a sensor with a FoV for the up/down scan.

Oh, the things we do for RViz. I think the proper way to do this is just to go with a non-planar view down with some very limited FoV. Essentially following the rough specs provided by whichever Tera* sensor you decide on. If you need some help on getting it to work, ping me back.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw: After thinking about the Teraranger a bit further, I don’t think we’re currently capable of simulating it in a realistic enough manner with Ignition’s sensor suite: [https://ignitionrobotics.org/docs/blueprint/comparison](https://ignitionrobotics.org/docs/blueprint/comparison) . The best sensor to simulate a ToF sensor is a Sonar sensor, which has not been migrated yet. I believe we should go with a single beam LIDAR Lite v3 equivalent for now.
content.html: After thinking about the Teraranger a bit further, I don’t think we’re currently capable of simulating it in a realistic enough manner with Ignition’s sensor suite: https://ignitionrobotics.org/docs/blueprint/comparison . The best sensor to simulate a ToF sensor is a Sonar sensor, which has not been migrated yet. I believe we should go with a single beam LIDAR Lite v3 equivalent for now.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw: I am fine with that.  As far as the sensors go, they behave pretty similarly.  We experimented with using the sonar from hector\_quadrotor under gazebo 9, but haven’t found an equivalent way of operating under ignition gazebo.  Is the lidar lite V3 sensor model complete in ignition?  I see something called GPU Lidar in the list you sent.  Is that what is used by the lidar lite?
content.html: I am fine with that. As far as the sensors go, they behave pretty similarly. We experimented with using the sonar from hector_quadrotor under gazebo 9, but haven’t found an equivalent way of operating under ignition gazebo. Is the lidar lite V3 sensor model complete in ignition? I see something called GPU Lidar in the list you sent. Is that what is used by the lidar lite?

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
Yes, there is no sonar sensor model yet in Ignition Gazebo.  I threw the LIDAR Lite v3 onto a bunch of models yesterday including this one: [#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/363](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/363)

I’d recommend checking that out, that’s almost exactly what you’re looking for.
content.html:
Yes, there is no sonar sensor model yet in Ignition Gazebo. I threw the LIDAR Lite v3 onto a bunch of models yesterday including this one: #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/363

I’d recommend checking that out, that’s almost exactly what you’re looking for.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw: The `<pose>` should use the `_z` parameter with an offset to take into account the vertical dimension of the vehicle. Eg. `#{_z + 0.2}`. The `_roll`, `_pitch`, `_yaw` parameters should be used as well. See #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/332/do-not-merge-example-team-robot-submission/diff?w=1#Lsubmitted_models/husky_migration_sensor_config_1/launch/spawner.rbT16.
content.html: The <pose> should use the _z parameter with an offset to take into account the vertical dimension of the vehicle. Eg. #{_z + 0.2}. The _roll, _pitch, _yaw parameters should be used as well. See #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/332/do-not-merge-example-team-robot-submission/diff?w=1#Lsubmitted_models/husky_migration_sensor_config_1/launch/spawner.rbT16.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
Please copy a working example of `example.ign` over to this PR or apply the diff below:
```
diff -r 817ebc97f188 submitted_models/ssci_x4_sensor_config_6/launch/example.ign
--- a/submitted_models/ssci_x4_sensor_config_6/launch/example.ign	Thu Dec 12 09:37:54 2019 -0500
+++ b/submitted_models/ssci_x4_sensor_config_6/launch/example.ign	Thu Dec 12 12:16:45 2019 -0500
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 <?xml version="1.0"?>
-<!-- Usage: ign launch preview.ign robotName:=<X1>
+<!-- Usage: ign launch path/to/example.ign robotName:=<X1>
 
    Parameters:
     robotName: Name to be assigned to model
@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@
 
   # Modify these as needed
   $enableGroundTruth = true
-  $headless = false
+  $headless =  local_variables.include?(:headless) ? :headless : false
 
 %>
 
@@ -23,6 +23,7 @@
   # This assumes that this launch file is in a directory below the model
   modelURI = File.expand_path("../", File.dirname(__FILE__))
   $worldName = 'example'
+  worldFile = File.join(File.expand_path("../worlds", File.dirname(__FILE__)), "#{$worldName}.sdf")
 
 %>
 
@@ -40,7 +41,7 @@
 
   <plugin name="ignition::launch::GazeboServer"
           filename="libignition-launch-gazebo.so">
-    <world_file>worlds/<%= $worldName %>.sdf</world_file>
+    <world_file><%= worldFile %></world_file>
     <run>true</run>
     <levels>false</levels>
     <record>
@@ -162,7 +163,8 @@
   </executable_wrapper>
   <%end%>
 
-<%= spawner(robotName, modelURI, $worldName, 0, 0) %>
+<%= spawner(robotName, modelURI, $worldName, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0) %>
+<%= rosExecutables(robotName, $worldName) %>
  
 </ignition>
 ```

Everything else looks good, can you please note that there is a RGBD camera attached to this model in the PR description?  Thank you, I'm going to go ahead and `approve` this for further validation from OSRF.  Please make the above changes.
content.html:
Please copy a working example of example.ign over to this PR or apply the diff below: ``` diff -r 817ebc97f188 submitted_models/ssci_x4_sensor_config_6/launch/example.ign --- a/submitted_models/ssci_x4_sensor_config_6/launch/example.ign Thu Dec 12 09:37:54 2019 -0500 +++ b/submitted_models/ssci_x4_sensor_config_6/launch/example.ign Thu Dec 12 12:16:45 2019 -0500 @@ -1,5 +1,5 @@ <?xml version="1.0"?> -<!-- Usage: ign launch preview.ign robotName:=<X1> +<!-- Usage: ign launch path/to/example.ign robotName:=<X1>

Parameters:
 robotName: Name to be assigned to model

@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@

# Modify these as needed $enableGroundTruth = true - $headless = false + $headless = local_variables.include?(:headless) ? :headless : false

%>

@@ -23,6 +23,7 @@ # This assumes that this launch file is in a directory below the model modelURI = File.expand_path("../", File.dirname(FILE)) $worldName = 'example' + worldFile = File.join(File.expand_path("../worlds", File.dirname(FILE)), "#{$worldName}.sdf")

%>

@@ -40,7 +41,7 @@

<plugin name="ignition::launch::GazeboServer" filename="libignition-launch-gazebo.so"> - <world_file>worlds/<%= $worldName %>.sdf</world_file> + <world_file><%= worldFile %></world_file> <run>true</run> <levels>false</levels> <record> @@ -162,7 +163,8 @@ </executable_wrapper> <%end%>

-<%= spawner(robotName, modelURI, $worldName, 0, 0) %> +<%= spawner(robotName, modelURI, $worldName, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0) %> +<%= rosExecutables(robotName, $worldName) %>

</ignition> ```

Everything else looks good, can you please note that there is a RGBD camera attached to this model in the PR description? Thank you, I'm going to go ahead and approve this for further validation from OSRF. Please make the above changes.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor config 2

content.raw:
This mostly looks good to me. Can you make the following two changes?

1. rename ssci\_X4\_sensor\_config\_6.xacro to ssci\_**x**4\_sensor\_config\_**2**.xacro? 
2. apply [this patch](https://gist.github.com/iche033/8fff01f577c53da9b6511488cbdcc0d8) to model.sdf to keep the model consistent with recent changes made  to X4. It updates shadows settings and add color to the propellers.

‌
content.html:
This mostly looks good to me. Can you make the following two changes?

  1. rename ssci_X4_sensor_config_6.xacro to ssci_x4_sensor_config_2.xacro?
  2. apply this patch to model.sdf to keep the model consistent with recent changes made to X4. It updates shadows settings and add color to the propellers.
